TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
Are there any plans to add a Twitch embed widget?  There used to be a BB code in the old forum software.  It'd be nice to get that back.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-07T03:24:54Z" title="11/07/2016 03:24  AM" data-short="7 yr">November 7, 2016</time> by Guest**

> 
> 
> On 10/30/2016 at 11:44 AM, Red Iron Crown said:
> 
> 
> We don't generally do announcements about changes to the moderation team.
> 

Could you start doing that, please? It's nice to know who is on the Mod team. Even a post in this subforum would work.

Besides, I need to know when to order the celebratory cakes.

> 
> 
> 34 minutes ago, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> Could you start doing that, please? It's nice to know who is on the Mod team. Even a post in this subforum would work.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Besides, I need to know when to order the celebratory cakes.
> 

You can check the list whenever you like, and mods have tags by their avatars.

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, Red Iron Crown said:
> 
> 
> You can check the list whenever you like, and mods have tags by their avatars.
> 

Well, yeah. But is there a reason the team is adverse to making announcements?

> 
> 
> Just now, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> Well, yeah. But is there a reason the team is adverse to making announcements?
> 

Other than it being a bit self-promoting, not really averse to it.

That and it's amusing when a new mod gets reported for backseat moderating.

Since [@Red Iron Crown](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/12858-red-iron-crown/) is a global moderator, does this mean that he can exert control over the United Nations? I think it would be cool to have a KSP forum moderator guiding that august body. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") (Seriously, congrats, I noticed this about two months ago... not sure when you added it!)

I get that reference.

>

> That and it's amusing when a new mod gets reported for backseat moderating.

Or impersonating staff.

Css Unoffical Space Shuttle Did you provide the link

(Please Link)

> 
> 
> On 11/5/2016 at 6:24 PM, FrankGoldwin said:
> 
> 
> Css Unoffical Space Shuttle Did you provide the link
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> (Please Link)
> 

Not sure what you mean? If you are looking for the download link for a specific mod, find that mod's thread and it should be in the first post.

Why yes, I *do* have a question for a moderator.

Hey [@Starhawk](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/131400-starhawk/), how's it going? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

> 
> 
> Just now, Kuzzter said:
> 
> 
> Hey [@Starhawk](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/131400-starhawk/), how's it going? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")
> 

Why just fine, thanks. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

Happy landings!

Congratulations, [@Starhawk](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/131400-starhawk/)! It was fairly obvious for a long time that they'd press-gang you into becoming a mod. You're one of the best members of the community that I know, and I'm not saying that to be nice. You're mature, helpful, omnipresent, and kind. If there was one person I would have recommended to be a mod, it is you.

Go forth, and do great things.

> 
> 
> 13 minutes ago, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> Congratulations, [@Starhawk](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/131400-starhawk/)! It was fairly obvious for a long time that they'd press-gang you into becoming a mod. You're one of the best members of the community that I know, and I'm not saying that to be nice. You're mature, helpful, omnipresent, and kind. If there was one person I would have recommended to be a mod, it is you.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Go forth, and do great things.
> 

Thank you, Dman, you are too kind.

Also, you, too, are kind. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Happy landings!
There goes the continent.

[@Starhawk](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/131400-starhawk/): Congrats! And don't worry too much about the comments of [@Frybert](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/97766-frybert/)... We, the community, welcome you! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

How's the shiny new mod badge [@Starhawk](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/131400-starhawk/)? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")  Congrats.  I, for one, welcome our new avian overlords.

Newbie. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P") It's ManeTI.
I have a question: What exactly does a "warning point" do? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 11 minutes ago, TheEpicSquared said:
> 
> 
> I have a question: What exactly does a "warning point" do? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

I dunno but I think I need to get some more because all of mine are expired ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

I'll see myself out..
What would happen if a dev has the same nickname as a forumer and needs a forum account as well?

> 
> 
> 24 minutes ago, TheEpicSquared said:
> 
> 
> I have a question: What exactly does a "warning point" do? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

They are a way of tracking repetitive rule breaking. Accumulate enough in a short enough amount of time and your account will be set to have content requiring moderator approval or, if enough points, banned.

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, legoclone09 said:
> 
> 
> What would happen if a dev has the same nickname as a forumer and needs a forum account as well?
> 

Situation hasn't occurred, I'm sure something could be worked out one way or another.

> 
> 
> 51 minutes ago, Red Iron Crown said:
> 
> 
> Accumulate enough in a short enough amount of time and your account will be set to have content requiring moderator approval or, if enough points, banned.
> 

Better yet, be one of them cool kids and don't accumulate any. Cool? Cool. ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif ":mad:")
